Html:
I have WPP last release. I have an MSI package to install and a client computer reports it as follows:

Status: Not installed
Approval: Install

I didn't change nor add any rule for the Msi installation.

Forcing a DetecNow/ReportNow in the log I can read 'Found 0 updates', but as far as I know there are no errors.
I had another package with the same problem but after some days it was in the 'not installed' state the client finally decided to download and install it !

Here is the last part of the log file:

Hi, the log is clean.
Ensure that client computers are allow to install third party updates :

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WindowsUpdate\AcceptTrustedPublisherCerts should be set to 1

I'm going to check but I bet it is set correctly.
This problem is too weird. As stated in my first post two weeks ago I forced lots of DetecNow/ReportNow in order to make the client install the msi package of Adobe Reader XI. Its status was correctly reported to be 'Not installed' but it was not downloaded. Suddenly, switching on the client computer after 10 days of inactivity, it was finally downloaded and installed. Now I have the same problem with the Reader XI msp patch and some other packages.

I'm going to open a new discussion which incidentally deals with Adobe Reader XI. Please consider that what I will write there is completely unrelated to this problem.

Bye
Filippo
Does these computers points to a upstream server or a downstream server ?
